message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE 

This paper deals with machine learning tasks such as multiclass classification, multilabel classification, and attention mechanisms, which are commonly studied in the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG), natural language processing (cs.CL), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computer vision (cs.CV), and neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE). The paper proposes a unified framework for probability mapping functions and introduces two novel sparse formulations, which are relevant to these sub-categories. The empirical evaluation of the proposed formulations on standard seq2seq tasks also suggests their relevance to these sub-categories.
